data.title: Pat Green to perform twice
data.meta_description: Friday, Saturday A few tickets still remain available for the first of two local performances by legendary Texas Country artist Pat Green on June 7 and 8 at the Aztec Theater. Seats for the second performance on Saturday, June 8 sold out weeks ago, but tickets can still be purchased online for Friday.
data.text:
A few tickets still remain available for the first of two local performances by legendary Texas Country artist Pat Green on June 7 and 8 at the Aztec Theater.

Seats for the second performance on Saturday, June 8 sold out weeks ago, but tickets can still be purchased online for Friday.

Sponsored by Albany Live, tickets are $75 for general admission and $100 for reserved seats online at www. albanylive.org.

“We are so excited to have Pat Green in Albany for two shows this weekend,” said Megaen Birdwell, anAlbany Live board member. “The Friday show will probably be a bit more intimate than on Saturday when the place will be packed and hopping.”

If tickets are still available on the day of the show, they will be sold at the door the night of the performance. Only cash or checks will be accepted at the door.

Originally, Green was scheduled to play only on Saturday, but he agreed to add a second show when the first one sold out so quickly.

“We are so excited to have an artist with such a long and great reputation in Texas country playing in Albany and at the Aztec,” board member Lynsi Musselman said.

Albany Live opened up more reserved seating for the Friday show so people can pick their seats.

The doors will open at the Aztec for the Friday performance at 7:00 p.m., with the show starting at 8:00 p.m. The Saturday performance will start at 7:00 p.m.

Green will also be in town to support a pop-up show by his wife, Kori, featuring her original jewelry designs. Her jewelry will be shown at Me and Mrs. Jones on Saturday across the street from the Aztec Theater.

Artist’s Background

Born in San Antonio, Texas, Pat Green firmly established himself as a Texas legend with his evocative blend of traditional and modern country music. He started his musical career playing at local bars while attending Texas Tech University, quickly capturing the hearts of listeners with his authentic sound and heartfelt storytelling

Green’s debut album, Dancehall Dreamer, released in 1995, marked the beginning of a celebrated journey that would deeply embed him in the fabric of Texas music culture.

His influence in Texas country music is underscored by a career that spans over two decades, with albums like Three Days and the gold-certified Wave on Wave.

Adding to his storied career, Pat Green just released a new song titled “Elvis in Memphis,” which promises to enchant listeners with its rich narrative and melodious charm.

Alongside his creative endeavors, Green continues to tour extensively across the United States, bringing his iconic music to fans old and new
